item.title: kora add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: kora add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: kora add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: kora add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: kora add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: kora add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: kora add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: kora add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: kora add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: kora add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: kora add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: kora add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: kora add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I drank because I wanted to drown my sorrows. But now the damned things have learned to swim ,and now decency and good behavior weary me." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: kora add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You can't just turn on creativity like a faucet. You have to be in the right mood. What mood is that? Last-minute panic." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: kora add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Things never happen the same way twice." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: kora add a quote by Robert R. McCammon
item.description: "...just shattered structures rising up like rotten teeth from a diseased jaw." -- Robert R. McCammon

item.title: kora add a quote by Robert McCammon
item.description: "Right." He smiled bitterly. "Well, look around. Just look. Have you ever considered the possibility that God might be insane?" -- Robert McCammon

item.title: kora add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "The song instantly insisted it'd never existed." -- David Mitchell

item.title: kora add a quote by Robert R. McCammon
item.description: "...hot shouts of neon..." -- Robert R. McCammon

item.title: kora add a quote by Robert R. McCammon
item.description: "...he was a scream wrapped up in straw, a little, weak, vicious thing gnashing inside a monstrous facade..." -- Robert R. McCammon

item.title: kora add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "That's what the world is , after all: an endless battle of contrasting memories." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: kora add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "...logical validity is not a guarantee of truth." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: kora add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: kora add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Te Occidere Possunt Sed Te Edere Non Possunt Nefas Est" ("They can kill you, but the legalities of eating you are quite a bit dicier")." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: kora add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "The music coming from inside sounded like robots fucking. And complaining about it. In rhythmic monotone. European robots." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: kora add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Not unlike the toaster, I control darkness." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: kora add a quote by Alan Lightman
item.description: "Imagine a world in which there is no time. Only images." -- Alan Lightman

item.title: kora add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: kora add a quote by Tim Burton
item.description: "One person's craziness is another person's reality." -- Tim Burton

item.title: kora add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "If you think anyone is sane you just don't know enough about them." -- Christopher Moore
